newsitem.title: USA: BPA raises firm off-peak power by 50c/MWh for Wed.
newsitem.headline: BPA raises firm off-peak power by 50c/MWh for Wed.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) withdrew offers for non-firm power during shoulder hours on Wednesday and raised prices for off-peak firm power by 50 cents per megawatt hour (MWh), the agency said Tuesday.
BPA also continued to hold off from offering firm power during next-day peak demand hours.
Firm off-peak power was offered at $9.50 per megawatt hour (MWh), up from $9.00 over the past couple of weeks.
For Wednesday, BPA continued to offer displacement power at $7.00 per megawatt hour (MWh), but narrowed the hours to 0100-0500 and 2400 PST, compared with 0100-0600 and 2300-2400 for Tuesday.
Prices for non-firm power during off-peak hours on Wednesday were unchanged at $9.00 per MWh.
